tool_description: This API contains data on critically endangered animals. Data comes from The IUCN Red List of Threatened Species.
name: Animals - Endangered - Environmentalism
title: Animals - Endangered - Environmentalism

api_list.name: Get Organism By Common Name
api_list.description: Retrieves an object containing an organism's information.
api_list.code:
import requests

url = "https://animals-endangered-environmentalism.p.rapidapi.com/common/chinese-alligator"

headers = {
            "X-RapidAPI-Key": "SIGN-UP-FOR-KEY",
            "X-RapidAPI-Host": "animals-endangered-environmentalism.p.rapidapi.com"
        }

response = requests.get(url, headers=headers)
print(response.json())
api_list.convert_code:
import requests

url = "https://animals-endangered-environmentalism.p.rapidapi.com/common/{name}"

headers = {
            "X-RapidAPI-Key": "SIGN-UP-FOR-KEY",
            "X-RapidAPI-Host": "animals-endangered-environmentalism.p.rapidapi.com"
        }

response = requests.get(url, headers=headers)
print(response.json())

api_list.name: Get Organism By Population Size
api_list.description:
Get Organism By Population Size.

Query can be one of equal, less, lessInc, more, moreInc.
Defaults to equal.
Equal returns organisms with a population equal to your parameter.
MoreInc returns organisms with a population greater than or equal to your parameter.

api_list.name: Get Organism By Taxonomy
api_list.description: Get Organism By Taxonomy. Query term defaults to mammalia.

api_list.name: Get Organism By Year Assessed
Get Organism By Population Trend
api_list.description:
Get Organism By Population Trend

Accepts decreasing, increasing, stable, unknown, or null.
api_list.code:
import requests

url = "https://animals-endangered-environmentalism.p.rapidapi.com/population-trend/increasing"

headers = {
            "X-RapidAPI-Key": "SIGN-UP-FOR-KEY",
            "X-RapidAPI-Host": "animals-endangered-environmentalism.p.rapidapi.com"
        }

response = requests.get(url, headers=headers)
print(response.json())
